nodes.text: BT-X2 or Botax and his counterpart NT-X2 were designed as a top-of-the-line Imperial assassin droids, however they were stolen mid-transport and ended up working for Luskin Exovar as a security guards at Exovar's Emporium.

After being stolen, Botax and Entax were sold by a shipjacker to Luskin Exovar to pay off a debt. Luskin, who was a droid lover at heart, tinkered with their programming and discovered that the two of them made an excellent security team.
Under the direction of Redeye, the Exovar's Emporium's head of security, the pair kept order in the otherwise chaotic facility.
Botax preferred conflict, and tended to be brash, loud, and quick with colorful threats.
Botax was designed by Paul Danner and Bill Smith for Wretched Hives of Scum & Villainy, a supplement for the Star Wars: The Roleplaying Game that was published by West End Games in 1997.
